meanings.definition: The round knob at the breech of a gun.
meanings.sent1: The soldier carefully adjusted the cascabel before firing the cannon.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the cascabel of the gun before loading it.
meanings.sent3: The cascabel on the gun seemed to have a personality of its own, always ready for action.
meanings.sent4: The cascabel of the gun gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of power and protection.
meanings.sent5: With a loud clang, the cascabel signaled the start of the battle.

meanings.definition: A small, round, hot chili pepper.
meanings.sent1: The chef added a cascabel to the spicy salsa for an extra kick.
meanings.sent2: The cascabel pepper gave the dish a fiery flavor that lingered on the palate.
meanings.sent3: Beware of the tiny but mighty cascabel, it packs a punch!
meanings.sent4: The cascabel pepper danced on the tongue, leaving a trail of heat behind.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the cascabel filled the kitchen, making mouths water in anticipation.
